To my understanding it is just the individual voting record of each congress person.
The two party system has historically been okay in the US but the country and political representatives are appearing to get more polarized. Eventually logic would follow that there will be a departure from just 2 parties
More legislatures voting party lines means less compromise which means less gets done

WRITING.TEXT: Long Island accents

Best thing I've learned about how to move up quickly - take on assignments that are highly likely to fail early in your career. You're young so someone might give you a shot thinking that there isn't much to lose. If it fails, they won't blame you and you will get good experience/exposure. If it succeeds, you will be a rockstar.

I ran a summer camp and a 14 year old girl got fingered in the swimming pond by a boy her same age. It was totally obvious as all the other kids swam around and they just stood there awkwardly. Wasn't nearly as bad as us having to tell her parents when they picked her up.

WRITING.TEXT:
You should look into bankruptcy. First you will need to get your parents off of your loans - you can do that if you paid your first three years and didn't take any deferment. Once they are off, just stop paying the private loans. If you declare bankruptcy the private loans would be wiped out but you'll still have to pay your Federal ones (probably much less expensive).
Do the math, you will never undig in a meaningful way from that debt load. While you bear some of the responsibility, the private loan companies partook in bad loan practices (think mortgage lenders circa 2006).
Good luck - totally sucks but there options.
